Such a beautiful, green and cool spot in the famous Napa Valley.

< Rating>
5<//Rating>
< text>
Elmshaven tour was very informing and pleasant. Expect Victorian style furniture throughout the home. The furniture is as close as possible as the original homeowners kept it. If you love History, or if you are open to expand your historic knowledge, this is a great place! And if you love the green outdoor scene and flowers, you can find it here.<//text>

< Text>
Elmshaven or house of Ellen G. White. Historical site with great importance for Seventh Day Adventists. Friendly staff that tell many interesting facts about the place and Ellen G. White that lived there from 1900 to 1915.</Text>

< Text>
Elmshaven is a beautiful place to visit ant to be taken back on time. Not only are you transported to the late 19th century but back to the fascinating history of the Seventh-Day Adventist Church.  It is truly remarkable to know that God's true spirit of prophecy and heavenly angels came to visit the home of Ellen G. White.  Remembering that if we have a genuine connection with God, our he too, can have heavenly visitors within it's walls.  You must visit for the history, but also for the religious reflection that your visit invokes. Many blessings as you visit...< /Text>

<rate>4< /rate>< review>
It helps if you're Seventh-day Adventist.  The tour guides are retired SDA pastors and their wives who seem to have been selected for their adherrence to "historic adventism" (very conservative.  You might want to avoid wearing shorts or jeans for this tour.)
The tour spiel varies from person to person.  Some are better and more informed than others.  You can expect to be proselytized and invited to pray by the end of the tour.< /review>

<UserId.>101111806317227347094<//UserId.><name>Sylvia Atkins<//name><Time>1499294036941<//Time>< rating>
4</rating>
<Text>Rather majestic initial fa√ßade, well-kept grounds, interesting and quaint home. It's free, although donations are encouraged, so I can't give it less than four stars. However, if you are not a Seventh-day Adventist, and don't have a  fascination with Ellen G White, I warn you that this tour is anything but "quick." ( Per the website's claim.)   Our tour guide spent  about  45 minutes in the first two rooms, giving us even unsolicited minute details of the prior homeowner's  experiences.

It's not the kind of place you can walk through on your own, unfortunately.    When we finally let the tour guide know we were on a limited time budget, he did step up his pace some.  If you are like us, I suggest you call ahead and ask for a private, short tour. Perhaps they will oblige. I'm sure they're all volunteers, and doing this out of the goodness of their hearts.<//Text>< Pictures>
None< /Pictures>

My range pulling a trailer is around 700 miles and the range without a trailer is 1100 miles. The trailer pulling range was a super great bonus.

< name>
Jeff T</name>

<rating>1<//rating>< text>
WE GOT A LEAKER!! Lol. Leaking, and spray liner are lifting up a few months out of warranty. Make sure you You keep all of your paper work on these boxes. I didn't keep my paper work and called about the leak I had and was told it wasn't under warranty. I believed their quick answer and moved on with life. The problem got MUCH worse moths later and I called them to see what I could do about it. I spoke with someone who spent MUCH more time on the phone with me. She said I was a couple months out of warranty, and I could send it in at my expense to have it fixed. Unfortunately, meaning when I did call 7 months earlier my box WAS under warranty. Everyone I spoke with on the matter at Fuelbox was very nice, but failed to fix the problem. Mine was used very lightly and didn't last for the premium amount paid in my opinion. Ill post a few pictures down below to show you what you can be dealing with for a box that is a couple years old and almost $3k investment. Again, everyone on the troubleshooting side was nice and respectful on the phone. She had me try a few fixes over the phone that were not successful.</text>

< Text>
Ftc90 87 gal with transfer pump and auto fuel plug and play

Installed on a 2020 f350. I have only run protech and highway prod for boxes and cab guards so I was a little worried about how durable this box tank combo would be. Time will tell but I can say I‚Äôm a 200lb man and standing in the center of the lid didn‚Äôt seem to bother it and I didn‚Äôt see any noticeable flex that would make me worry. Install was straight fwd and I think the instructions they supply are good. As far as the the auto fuel controller it is WAY WAY WAY to bright to the point of it having a sticky note on it now but I am considering trying some window tint film to dim it down. With the 2020 Ford superduty the fuse box under the the hood is on the Right ‚Äúpassenger‚Äù side so the power supply wires had to be extended but it worked great for the transfer pump being it is on the same side. Price is pretty high and I wish they would sell the auto fuel control by it self but Overall I would say I am pleased<//Text>

<user_id>113224422168461556238</user_id><Name>Rangaprabhu Parthasarathy< /Name>< time>
1381563918819< /time>
< rate>
4</rate>
< Review>
We arrived fairly late by a work day lunch standards at 1 pm. We managed to get seating outside. It was a pleasant and breezy afternoon. I scrounged the menu for good vegetarian lunch type food. As luck would have it, the soup of the day was tortilla soup and it was not made with chicken stock (always the first question with soup). They also offered a falafel burger which looked exotic enough for me to order.

Complimentary bread arrived instantly. The food arrived in about 10 minutes and the soup piping hot. Worked very well for the outdoor breezy ambiance. It had a spicy kick to it and  felt great. The burger was very interesting. It was a pita sleeve with a falafel inside. It also had some olive relish in it which was very tasty. Overall, the lunch was excellent. Unfortunately for me, the menu does not offer very many lunch options that are designed to be vegetarian. They can do a bunch of swaps and replacements but nothing that is originally expected to be vegetarian. And therein lies the only downside to an otherwise great restaurant for lunch.</Review>

<Name>Chris Hathaway</Name><Resp>{'time': 1594313331123, 'text': 'Hello Chris, My name is Juan and I am one of the owners here at Sweet Dreams. This was brought up to me this morning and after reading your review I have a better understanding of what went on. I can assure you this is not the impression we would like to leave behind with any of our valued customers. I do understand that there is a language barrier between our staff and customers and we do try to have one bilingual person per shift. I sincerely apologize for the way you felt from our actions. I have the names of both employees who assisted you and will have a conversation with them today as well. I hope this message finds you well and hope that this does not occur here of anywhere else as this is not tolerated. I do want to express that both employees do like to laugh a lot and play around, I have told them before that at work this can not be done as it can be interpreted in many ways. Again my sincerest apologies.\n\nThank you,\n\nJuan Mijangos\nPartner/Owner\n7073869950'}< /Resp>< text>
I was laughed at as I watched The cooks put extra hot salsa on my burrito when I requested simply pico de gallo. The lady making it was not at fault. I was humiliated by The Man Behind the Counter laughing at me knowing I didn't speak Spanish. At no time did I say anything rude. In fact I hardly said anything at all. I attempted to correct the mistake before it started by requesting it a second time, also adding that I am sensitive to spicy foods but her colleague laughed even harder as she poured the hot salsa on it. Finally after all is said and done and they brought the burritos forward to be paid for. I politely handed over $4 for her employees effort knowing it wasn't her intent to do harm. It seemed she was surprised when I told her that I was not interested in the burritos anymore and to have a nice day.

Upon speaking with the manager over the phone, I expressed my distaste for the situation. I felt humiliated, cornered and to a degree discriminated against. Such outrageous accusations deserve some context. I a non Spanish speaking middle-aged male entered a predominantly Spanish speaking establishment. Nothing new there. I entered this restaurant like many others in the past where I didn't speak the common language used at that establishment fluently or even a little bit. Never have I felt the way I do today in similar surroundings. I will say the language barrier was openly obvious and seemingly insurmountable to the point where I felt it was best to leave The establishment instead voicing my current level of frustration which would be a disturbance, I could wait for a phone call. What struck me is odd was that the manager spoke English very well. Being a small establishment she not only remembered me over the phone but I spoke with her at one brief point.

The question I have for her is if a customer who has spent the last 15 to 20 minutes in your establishment who you yourself said you remembered me allowed your employee to laugh at me while the other was making a debauchery of my burrito?
The next question I have is if a customer is visibly upset in front of you for an order he placed that was not prepared correctly and felt discriminated because he could not communicate properly in the language spoken the proper corrections to ensure proper customer satisfaction not only while you were observing (as you said over the phone) but failed to investigate, query the customer or employees for the obvious dissatisfaction of one of your customers?

Before I left you acted as if my business was of no consequence.  I can tell you that in these times, these socially tense times, how you treat other people can go a lot longer than it did before. If we are all to get along in this City let alone our state or Nation then it's encounters like this that can make or break the feelings of equality. I am not mad at the cook who tried to prepare my burrito. She spoke very little English and I speak extremely limited Spanish. So placing an order is to be expected to have some possible mistakes in the preparation. I even forgive the guy that was laughing at me for he does not know me, and is of no consequence to me at this point. However I cannot let it go yet because at the last moment seeing my emotional response being withheld I didn't get even an apology just a confused look on her face.

It's always a shame when people need to learn lesson about how to treat other people at your own expense. All I can say in the end is that I do not intend to visit this establishment in the near future if ever. I am quite confident that there food choices are above standard. I'm also confident that had the communication barrier between the cooks and I was not nearly as prominent or had the manager intervened and assisted me and her employee then I would be sitting on my couch enjoying a nice asada burrito.</text>

<Time>1616701988260< /Time>< user_id>
116560131182191377336<//user_id>
<Rating>5<//Rating>< text>
One of my cylindrical garage door springs snapped after my wife left for work, so I found myself stuck in the garage a short while later.  I found the contact info for Entry Systems and promptly called them.  Gaby was very helpful in arranging an immediate opening while also explaining to me the estimated cost for the repair and for other services I was interested in.  She was able to get a technician dispatched and he arrived within 15 minutes.
John was very professional and thorough in explaining the process of the repair.  I left him to do his thing and an hour later, everything was working smoothly with the new springs and a new drum.  It's been a couple days now and I'm happy to report that the door continues to work smoothly and quietly.  When the time comes for me to upgrade my opener to a belt-drive or converting my third garage door back to an operating state, I'm sure I will be calling up Entry Systems to help me with my needs!<//text>

<Text>This review is for Glenn and Entry Systems. Our garage door was giving us some issues, sometimes it wouldn't stay closed as if there was something blocking the sensors (but they were clear), sometimes the door would shutter when moving. We called Entry Systems- Glenn was very punctual and within a half hour of inspection was able to explain (and physically show) to me what was wrong with my door. He was very up front in letting me know that replacement was not yet necessary but showed me how the motor, springs, sensors, and cables were wearing from age and use. We decided to go ahead and replace the motor and springs anyways, rather than wait for the door to break on us in a year from now. Glenn returned a week later with all the right parts, and within a few hours managed to install our new system, show us how to properly operate it, and leave us very confident the new door was a good purchase.

If we ever have a problem with our garage door I know I would absolutely call Entry Systems again. It turns out you /can/ put a price on great service. <review>Spoke to Amy Friday morning.  She was very pleasant and helpful.  I didn't need a same day appointment, so we set it up for the following Monday afternoon.  Jonathan showed up, talked to me for a few minutes, asked me some questions, assessed the situation, then told me what needed to be done.  He also suggested I replace the springs.  He was clear it wasn't necessary, but, given how old they were, it might be a good idea.  No sales pitch, no pressure, just a professional recommendation.  He clearly knew what he was talking about.  We agreed on the work, agreed on the price, and he went to work.  As he finished and was testing everything out, he noticed the wall mounted opener button was faulty.  No problem, he throws a new one on, no charge.  He explains what he did, shows me all the new parts, and asks if I have any questions. <Rating>5<//Rating>< Review>
I currently have a solid slab garage door.  Before having a new garage door installed, I will need to have the custom cabinetry in my garage remodeled, in order to accommodate the overhead tracks for the sectional door.  I needed a precise measurement done, so that I can communicate with the cabinet makers, in order to have the cabinets reduced in size, before the new garage door tracks can be installed.  Jonathan came to visit, took precise measurements, explained exactly what modifications will need to be done to my cabinets, and explained how he can make minor modifications to the door track, in order to minimize the loss of storage cabinet space in the garage.  He also explained the benefits of different grades of replacement garage doors available, so that I will be able to make a selection, after the cabinets have been modified to allow for installation of the door tracks.  He is very knowledgeable and answered all my questions and was very generous with his time.  This was a very good experience, and I will choose Entry Systems to install my new garage door, after the cabinetry has been modified.</Review>

<review>Happy I chose Entry Systems to fix my garage door. The torsion spring was broken and the belt was worn and needed to be replaced. <Name>Ben Hatfield< /Name><time>1451939452489<//time><rate>5<//rate><review>Holy crap.  The last time I went to the dentist for an extraction, the procedure was painful, frightful, and, to be brutally honest, unforgettable.  That experience is why I've waited for more than 5 years to return.  Granted, I'm paying for it now with all of the procedures that I need done, but at the time, I figured and thought that I would just let all my teeth fall out on their own and get dentures.  Well, my lovely wife finally convinced me to go back to the dentist.  Today, I had two extraction done at 945am.  The process was ABSOLUTELY and INCREDIBLY PAINLESS!!!  The dentist was nice, caring, and, for as much as can be expected, gentle.  Here it is 1228pm on the same day and my mouth has no pain OR swelling. There are multiple reasons why we give this office a top rating. This was the 4th dentist office my husband and I have gone to in the 2 years we've lived in CA. The entire process was great. < review>
Jeff is such a baller, along with his apprentice, Brenton. I acquired a bike that needed the rubber inner tubing replaced. It was in dire need of service.

I called Jeff and even with the standard hourly charge and price on the new tube, after I brought it in he gave me the flat fix charge which minimized my cost. I'm so grateful for his customer service and ethics.

Thanks Stray Dog, I'll return in due time.</review>

< Text>

< review>
This is my first time doing business with Tricon. So far everything has gone smoothly. The application/approval process was fast and the website is pretty user friendly. My point of contact,  Brian Holzwarth, was great! He always responded in a timely fashion, and answered my questions before and after my big move. My move in date was pushed out due to unforeseen circumstances, but I ended up with a brand new kitchen :-) Brian kept me updated throughout the process. The house was painted, inside and out, clean, and everything in working order. My only complaint is the ‚ÄúSmart Home‚Äù feature. The interface lacks everything offered by smart devices. I would have declined this option if I knew how bad it was. I‚Äôm reaching out to find out if I can get out of paying the extra $17/month for this useless ‚Äúfeature‚Äù

Most obvious issue with ‚ÄúSmart Home‚Äù  (Thermostat and Lock) is you have to go to the Tricon website, log in, and wait for the page to load, then select which device you‚Äôd like to control, and wait for that to load before anything can be done.

Thermostat -
Pros:
1. The interface allows u to raise and lower the temperature.

Cons:
1. It can‚Äôt be voice controlled by Google home or Alexa
2. It isn‚Äôt programmable
3. There is no option for alerts of temp changes
4. There is no app to quickly make changes

Door lock -
Pros:
1. You can lock and unlock the door

Cons:
1. It can‚Äôt be voice controlled by Google home or Alexa
2. I don‚Äôt get alerts on who unlocks the door
3. No tamper alarm
4. No option to auto lock
5. There is no app to quickly make changes< /review>

<Resp>{'time': 1620181399794, 'text': "Christopher Martin, we are sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with the application process here at Tricon Residential. At Tricon Residential, in order to treat everyone equitably and stay in compliance with Fair Housing and Equal Opportunity laws, we utilize a third-party credit rating agency. The agency objectively qualifies all applicants to rent our homes. Each applicant's privacy and personal information is completely confidential.  As part of this confidentiality, we would never discuss contributing factors to our decision on such a public forum such as this.  However, as stated in our terms of agreement that was signed when submitting the application, the items considered for rental qualifications include criminal history, previous evictions, bankruptcy, landlord collections, utility delinquencies, FICO score, rent-to-income ratio, civil court history, level of collections, charge-offs length of rental history, and late payments.  Beyond the landlord collections, we look at your credit history, the quality and quantity of your credit.  While you did not meet our rental qualifications, we thank you for considering Tricon Residential in your rental search and wish you the best in all future endeavors."}< /Resp><Time>1619117154069< /Time><Pictures>None<//Pictures>< user_id>

< text>
The physical location in my state is listed as "Permanently Closed" but the website still exists. It only has a single contact number, which I've tried calling. (Same name, messaging system, and website look as this location.) The first time I waited on hold for a person and got hung up on. The second time I left a number to call me back at. They actually did call me back, and I asked to speak with the person who had emailed me asking for a move-in date so they could send the lease because that person has not responded back after a full day and two emails. I was put on hold, waited two or three minutes and then I got hung up on again.

EDIT: I got a call back from someone in my area and they explained that the location thing is to get all the reviews in one place. The messaging system is the same because every call is going through the one place right now, while they make system changes. Said system work is making calls drop or something. They got me the majority of my lease information before they called me and the rest right after. Super happy with the agent I spoke to.

I think it would help if Tricon could at least put a note on the site about maintenance on the phone system to reassure others that they're aware of possible difficulties with contact and it's being addressed. Also please find something besides the incredibly disconcerting closing of locations to do that still gets all the reviews where they need to be to get a single score. My suggestion if there isn't another option with Google would be to re-open the local places and instead have the numbers get reported up to the home office to be averaged or something similar.

I cannot figure out how to delete the review and I don't want to leave a bad one. I'm really hoping that my problems were just a bad first impression, and I'll update again after more data points. (Original 1 averaged with the 5 star response gets a 3.)<//text>

< review>
I have just recently moved out of a Tricon American Home rental.  I was at my location just at 2 years.  From the day I called to set up a self tour to the day and days after move out, I was pleasantly surprised with this rental company.  Move in was made simple and my move in inspector was kind, thorough, and helpful.  The few times I had maintenance issues, they were handled courteously and swiftly.  The maintenance crew was extremely helpful, polite, prompt, and made us feel comfortable in our home.  Although I was not thrilled with the rent amount for the square footage, I was very pleased with the accounting department and their responsiveness.  This company does a great job with tenants.  I would rent from this company again.< /review>

< review>
Stay away - this company is dishonest to say the least! About 2 months ago, I contacted Tricon about a home I found on their website. I let them know my move-in date and they were very friendly in helping me apply for the home I was interested in. Well, the kindness ended there! 3 weeks before my move-in date, the property manager called me regarding a couple of questions I asked over email, as we were talking my move-in date came up. She said it was not guaranteed that I could move in by that date and that I should look for another home - mind I had paid them $350 to hold the home and she did not every try to apologize for what happened.

Fast forward to 1 week before my move-in date - I have to call the property manager several times to get an answer and when I finally get ahold of her she "can't give me an update," even though the move-out inspection was suppose to be done 3 days prior. I call the general customer service line to try to speak to a supervisor and it takes her 2 days to get back to me, ridiculous! Turns out, the prior resident did not move out and I won't be able to move in. Not only that, but they allow residents to give absolutely no notice on not moving out - which in turn completely screws over people that have been 'promised' and have paid for holding the home. Mind this gives me 1 week to find a new home, again, absolutely no apologies from the property manager OR the supervisor and it felt like they were both robots that had no human side and just talked policy.

<user_name>Tanisha Carroll</user_name><date>1615837551672</date><Rate>4<//Rate>< Review>
I‚Äôve been renting with Tricon since 2018. I moved into my second home still renting through them December 2020. The reason I decided to stay renting with them instead of going somewhere else was one because they are first come first serves bias. Which is what drove me to them in 2018 to begin with. They don‚Äôt take your money and everyone else‚Äôs looking at the same home like a lot of these renting agencies and then choose which person they want to go with. Instead, if you and another family is looking at the same home, they only allow one person to pay. If the family doesn‚Äôt meet the requirements then they will alert you to finish the application process (which will be the payment of the application fees).

The next thing I appreciate about Tricon is working with Latoshia Bates. My husband was involved in a gunshot accident in August 2020 and it left him paralyzed from the waist down. I was already out of a job due to COVID-19 and now he was too. Instead of not letting us transfer to another one of their properties (due to having to have a more wheelchair accessible home) they did with no problem and didn‚Äôt penalize us for not working. Latoshia Bates helped with  the entire transfer process as much and best as she could and I want to thank them for her and the company as a whole. I gave a 4 because when it came to speaking to others in the company the timing on getting back to me was not as prompt. However, Ms. Bates was very good at getting back to me and helping solve or deescalate any problems that came my wayü§ó‚ÄºÔ∏è They also will work with the family during COVID-19 issues as well.

Overall, I definitely would recommend this company to anyone who is looking to rent. I‚Äôve actually recommended my uncle, and my brother in law and his wife.  The only down side is that they do not give out rewards for recommendations.<//Review>

{'time': 1607448194708, 'text': 'Pamela, we are sorry to hear about your disappointing experience with Tricon American Homes. We provide perspective residents with the option to view a home should they wish prior to applying if the home is move-in ready. In some cases, properties are undergoing the maintenance process and touring is unfortunately not available at that point in time. We provide perspective residents with the option to apply for the home if they wish to reserve the property or to wait until the home is ready for viewing before beginning the application process. We are transparent with our fees, which are $49.99 per applicant over the age of 18 and $250 for the holding fee. As listed in our Terms of Agreement if you are approved and moved in, the $250 will be applied to your first month‚Äôs rent. If you are approved and do not move in, you will forfeit the $250. If you are denied, you will be refunded the $250. If you are approved and decide to transfer your application to another home, you will forfeit the $250. We initially approved you for a home and were advised 3 weeks later that you wanted to transfer your application to another home, at this time we transferred your application and all fees, including the $250 holding fee that should have been forfeited to the new home. Once this transfer was complete, we were once again advised that you wished to transfer the application to another home. Unfortunately, as this was the second transfer your holding fee was forfeited and we required a new holding fee be paid, which we credited towards the first months rent once you executed your lease. We have confirmed that a member of our maintenance team has reached out to you directly to address all maintenance issues. Our sincerest apologies that your home was not up to Tricon‚Äôs standards at the time of your move-in. We will continue to work together on this issue to ensure all is resolved. We appreciate your residency and allowing us an opportunity to work together offline.'}< /Response>
< Review>
RENTERS BEWARE! I only wish that I had read the reviews before even considering renting from Tricon American Homes.  I have been here two weeks and this has been two weeks from hell.  First, I had to pay fees to hold the house and for a background check before I could view the home.  If I didn‚Äôt like the home after viewing  it, I would lose the money I paid in fees.  If I saw another house of interest, I would have to pay another holding fee and for another background check.  You pay these fees for every home you‚Äôre interested in.  I‚Äôve lost close to a $1,000 before moving into the house I‚Äôm now.  Anyway, the third house that I paid a holding fee and background fee check on I had to move into because I couldn‚Äôt afford to lose any more money.  I also had to pay the deposit and first month‚Äôs rent before even being able to view this home.  Did I mention all the money paid was non refundable?  I am paying $1,595 per month, plus a mandatory Smart Home fee.  I am paying more than $700 than  this house is worth.  First, the house was filthy when I moved in.  The fireplace was dirty.  The cabinets were dirty and had food remnants in them.  The floors were dirty.  The basement had huge dead bugs and rodent droppings. I mean huge! I don‚Äôt even want to go down there.  It appeared that the previous tenants did wood work in the basement and there is saw dust everywhere.  No one bothered to clean it.  The walls (water stains?) and floors are filthy and there is a huge hole in the wall of the basement.  The basement door doesn‚Äôt close properly.  Someone can push the door and live in the basement without my daughter and I even knowing.  The house was not move-in ready like I promised it would be.  The house is a dump, uninhabitable, and unsafe.  The roof and flooring  have significant damage.  There are some places that leaks.  They covered holes in the floor with carpeting.  My daughter and I have injured ourselves by stepping in those holes and/or tripping on uneven flooring.  Electrical outlets are not secured to the wall.  The light fixture in the second bathroom is not secure and looks as if it‚Äôs about to fall any minute.  The wall in my daughter‚Äôs bedroom was not properly painted.  The vents are not secured to the wall.  Blinds are broken.  Some windows can‚Äôt open, which is terrible because the house had a horrible odor when we moved in.  Ventilation is poor.  The windows are drafty.  We hear, what we believe, are rodents in the ceiling.  According to the Smart Home App, the kitchen sink was leaking prior to me moving in and it‚Äôs still leaking. < text>
I‚Äôve been currently renting from them for about two years now and I would say it‚Äôs not best but it‚Äôs also not the worst. When it comes to maintenance issues I have to say that is their upside because every time I have had an issue they have always gone above and beyond to fix the problem. However, I spend over $1500 a month in rent alone and I don‚Äôt have a dishwasher, and I also have no storage space what so ever not even a linen closet. I have to keep my vacuum in my closet with my clothing along with the mop and my towels which is not very sanitary. Same with the washer and dryer space there is not even a shelving unit to put soap or anything I just leave it on top of my dryer. The bathroom vanity is small and can only fit soap and toothbrush holder. Every year they have increased my rent which is expected but this past year was a leap year and they charged me an extra day for the leap year and prorated an extra day which is fine but extremely petty if you ask me after always paying on time. I also was paying over $300 a month for my power bill for a long time until called about my ac unit and they came out realized half the house needed to be re-insulated and the coil to be cleaned. Which after they have done has decreased dramatically since however I wish I called before. All in all it‚Äôs not terrible but not amazing. If the rent was cheaper I probably wouldn‚Äôt complain but for over $1500 and every increase, some storage space would be nice. We have had contractors in and out of the house for months.  My wife and I have taken plenty of days off of work for maintenance people to access the home. I've never wanted to give up on life so much like I did when This all happened!!! I didn't know how I was going to support my kids or even continue living life without my father!!! One day I reached out to Tricon and Bridget Jones answered my phone call to ask her what my options were and to let her know that I'm trying everything I could to pay my rent! I just didn't want to lose our home!!! She not only answered my questions but she actually showed that she cared and was literally the ears that I needed to listen before I was about to go crazy!!! Thank you for taking the time to let us know so we can improve.\n\nAt Tricon American Homes, we value every customer and in order to treat everyone equitably, we utilize a third party credit rating agency. The portal currently requires me to pay my rent total as well as the $16.00. < text>
The entire process from finding a home to moving was a breeze. I was a little skeptical because the company is not local and all communication was via email but after speaking to Amira, I felt completely safe to move forward with the move in process. Sunday afternoon I drove around and looked at homes (self tour), found the perfect home....went back home and applied that same night. The next morning (before noon), I had an approval email from Tricon! From there it took no more than 72hrs to get everything finalized.
Fast forward to moving in....On the first day, I met with Michael, who did a walk-in inspection with me (first time experiencing this) and he ensured EVERYTHING worked probably and wrote down any issues that I saw (which was only a smell when the water was ran...that was fixed the follow calendar day)! The move in process took about an hour because he was very informative and made sure I understood how to submit maintenance requests in the future. The entire Tricon Team was awesome to work with. The only ‚ÄúCon‚Äù is that I‚Äôm currently having an issue with them withdrawing my first month payment and I‚Äôm being charged for something I believe I shouldn‚Äôt be charged for. Other than that, everything else is going amazingly! I couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better company to rent from! Oh, did I mentioned they rent out NEWLY BUILT Homes...such an amazing feeling to be the first one to live in a home and not worry too much about maintenance!!! Nice job on everything Tricon, I‚Äôve been recommending you‚Äôll and will continue to recommend you‚Äôll to any and everyone.< /text>

< Text>
As a REALTOR of many years, I've leased a fair share of properties, both as a listing agent and representing the tenant. Rentals in the Phoenix area are in short supply and it makes it very hard to help tenants find a property to lease. Great customer care. But should be more open minded about accepting HUD HOUSING. IF COMPANIES TRULY THINK ABOUT IT AND STOP DISCRIMINATING de to stereotypes see as black or brown low class rowdy misbehaving ingrates. Or lazy not wanting to work individuals. That's not always the case. HUD guarantees 90% of their monthly rent portions so it's more then likely the tenant will stay long and pay their small portion. With a regular tenant it's more worry of a eviction , running out on rent , having to sue and court fees. Don't screen HUD participants by their race or your personal views. Go on their History of not having a criminal background , no destruction of property,no police reports, on time rent payments , or if they have many kids . Doesn't mean their bad they could be straight A non problematic children. Assumptions are WRONG. Give people a fighting chance you never know what's really going on. These people are coming off the streets. Your life too can be changed in a matter of moments or based of one bad decision , a unlawful loss of a job , no family support etc. Not everything is black and white</Text>

{'time': 1589999531636, 'text': 'Richard, thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. At Tricon American Homes, we consistently apply the same responsible applicant screening criteria to all applicants in full compliance with all applicable state and federal fair housing requirements. To ensure a fair, consistent, and appropriately rigorous review in all cases, we retain a third party to review each applicant by consistently applying the same criteria. These reviews are comprehensive and include verification of employment, recorded evictions, and criminal convictions. Should your background check come back and is cleared, your application is approved pending verification of income you listed on your application. Upon submission of the rental application, you agreed to the Company‚Äôs Terms of Agreement as well as paid a non-refundable application fee per applicant and a $250 non-refundable holding deposit.  Our non-refundable holding deposit is in place as a formal expression of intent to acknowledge the prospective resident‚Äôs hold on a home while the application is processed. In order to continue the leasing process additional documentation was needed. In accordance with our Terms of Agreement, and in observance of Fair Housing, we universally apply the same standards to all our prospective residents, therefore the holding fee has not been returned. Thank you.'}</resp>

< Rate>
1</Rate>
< Text>
Make sure you want the place for sure before you even consider applying to one of their homes. They have a clause that states there is a $250 holding fee IN ADDITION to your application fees. They say if you are denied, you get refunded the fee. But if you are approved and choose not to move in, you are not refunded.

In our situation (4 roommates total), it was $50 for each app and then that holding fee. It wasn't even an hour (if that) after we applied that we seemed to have been auto accepted. BUT we had been applying to other places as well, and of course we decided to go with a better house that accepted us shortly after.

The thing I have a problem with is that they seemed to have AUTO accepted us. They didn't even have any proof of income from us or anything else of that nature. Guess why they did that? So they wouldn't have to give back that extra $250 if we decided to decline their approval. $250 goes a long way when you're as young as we are. Every penny counts, and that was a really shady way to do business. I don't mind losing application fees. Those are a given. But don't auto-approve people like that with NO proof of income or credit just to get your greedy paws on an extra $250. Bad business.<//Text>
<Pics>None< /Pics><Response>{'time': 1574719348931, 'text': 'Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.  At Tricon American Homes, we consistently apply the same responsible applicant screening criteria to all applicants in full compliance with all applicable state and federal fair housing requirements. To ensure a fair, consistent and appropriately rigorous review in all cases, we retain a third party to review each applicant by consistently applying the same criteria. These reviews are comprehensive and include verification of employment, recorded evictions, and criminal convictions. Should your background check come back and is cleared, your application is approved pending verification of income you listed on your application. Upon submission of the rental application, you agreed to the Company‚Äôs Terms of Agreement as well as paid a non-refundable application fee per applicant and a $250 non-refundable holding deposit.  Our non-refundable holding deposit is in place as a formal expression of intent to acknowledge the prospective resident‚Äôs hold on a home while the application is processed. In accordance with our Terms of Agreement, and in observance of Fair Housing, we universally apply the same standards to all our prospective residents, therefore the holding fee has not been returned.  Thank you.'}</Response><Gmap_id>0x80dcdeebf76d28e7:0xd40e54b6d26af133<//Gmap_id></record>

<rate>4<//rate>< text>
I rented from tricon for almost five years with no issues. I gave my notice to vacate right before the covid 19 drama started. With the pandemic going on I asked for a 30 day extension, they were nice enough to agree and I paid the full 30 days rent. I was ready and able to move out at month end but was asked to stay an extra 8 days since a technician was unavailable until then. I agreed, but upon logging on to the resident portal I found that I had a balance for the extra 8 days. I emailed Denise Bledsoe and she responded that I was responsible for the charges. I didn't ask for the extra 8 days so I called and emailed to no response. I received my security deposit balance in the mail and they charged me the almost $500 for the 8 days I didn't ask for!! In the middle of a pandemic!! Unprofessional and unsympathetic. Do not rent from them.

UPDATE 6/17/2020:
I was contacted by Claudia. She listened to my concerns and explained how their system worked. Although I am disappointed it took a google review to rectify the situation, it was resolved and I was refunded the balance.<//text>

<review>My family and I have lived in a home rented from Tricon since November 2017. Since then we've made 10 requests to have someone come and "fix" the plumbing. There are broken pipes under our home, which is causing massive amounts of water leakage and will cause the foundation to ruin. We signed another lease in 2018 - big mistake. The person who came to look at our home today said they would have to contact the last vendor that Tricon sent and that there was nothing he could do. DON'T RENT FROM THEM.
Our neighbor is living in one of their properties. A few years ago, the neighbors called the company to have our mutual fence replaced. It's a 40 year old fence, that was being held together by a nail and a prayer. It took the company weeks to return a call, and finally send someone out. They propped up their sides with 1 board, and called it "fine".
Fast forward to a month ago. We decided to remove some ivy from the tree in our backyard, and some of it was attached to the fence. Needless to say, the whole fence started coming apart. Boards dropping, poles falling out of holes, etc.  We got ahold of the neighbor who gave us Tricon's information. So we and the neighbor who rents from them called them to let them know we needed to put up a new fence. Over a week went by, we tried emailing, and....nothing. The neighbor has a dog, and so we HAD to replace the fence asap. We found someone to do it, for a very reasonable price.
We have since contacted Tricon MULTIPLE times, and they are refusing to pay their half stating that its because they didn't use "their contractor"
We would have be fine using "their" person, but the company never got back to us to set up a time, and it had to be done.
I can't believe the lack of professionalism from this company.
If you are local, you are waaaaay better off renting from Solano Property Management.< /Review>

They said that if someone else has applied/paid the holding fee, IT WILL REMOVE THE HOME OFF THE MARKET AND THAT'S WHY I WOULD BE ADDED TO A WAITLIST. Keep that in mind....Well, I went to their website and looked up the home--still showed available, so I went through the entire application process. Other than that, they said we were APPROVED, and that they LOOK FORWARD TO SERVING US AS THEIR RESIDENT. That means we got the house don't you think??? Keep that in mind now. So fast forward to the next day, I can't remember at this point if they called me to inform me about the other applicant, or if I originally called them first to check the status of the pending ID and income verification, but regardless of who called who first, that's when I was informed of another applicant for the same home. If someone else applied and was that close to approval, that means THEY would've paid the holding fee, which should then have made the home UNAVAILABLE TO OTHER APPLICANTS! Am I right, or am I just crazy?? And on top of all that, WHY WOULD YOU SAY I'M APPROVED FOR A HOME WHEN YOU ALREADY HAVE ANOTHER APPLICANT AHEAD OF ME WAITING TO SIGN A LEASE?????? NONE of it makes sense to me. Well fast forward a couple of hours, and sure enough that other applicant came through and was approved and somehow my approval email was a lie? I was told THAT DAY (4/8/2020) that my holding fee was refunded. I have all of that in a text still. I was told that as far as when the refund would hit my bank account depended on the bank, so I figured maybe a day or two and I would have my refund back. Nope. <Rate>1< /Rate><Text>My story is so long, I wouldn't know where to start.
I'm giving 2 stars, because approval till move in was ok. However from the day of move in on June 12th, until today I'm dealing with unprofessional and unreliable contractors. It took them 1 month to fix most of my issues,  from sheetrock, to paint, to leaking ceiling, leaking toilets, leaking faucets etc. My house was definitely not "ready move in". Update 9/17/18

To ensure a fair, consistent and appropriately rigorous review in all cases, we retain a third party to review each applicant by consistently applying the same criteria. These reviews are comprehensive and include verification of employment, recorded evictions, and criminal convictions. Should your background check come back and is cleared, your application is approved pending verification of income you listed on your application. Upon submission of the rental application, you agreed to the Company‚Äôs Terms of Agreement as well as paid a non-refundable application fee per applicant and a $250 non-refundable holding deposit.  Our non-refundable holding deposit is in place as a formal expression of intent to acknowledge the prospective resident‚Äôs hold on a home while the application is processed. In accordance with our Terms of Agreement, and in observance of Fair Housing, we universally apply the same standards to all our prospective residents, therefore the holding fee has not been returned. Horrible customer service to go along with a horrible rental company. Host of issues since before moving in. Should have never rented with Tricon. We‚Äôve been in this Tricon home (in the Charlotte area) for a little over a month and it‚Äôs been issue after issue.

Currently have been without a/c for six days. Tricon had a contractor come out last Wednesday to look at it. Contractor determined it needed parts ordered and said they‚Äôd contact us in 24-48 hours. After they didn‚Äôt, we contacted the contractor and asked them what the issue was ‚Äî they informed us that Tricon wouldn‚Äôt let them order the parts needed to fix the unit, leaving us without a/c for going on a week now.

We were finally able to reach Tricon this morning and they are finally sending a new contractor today. They also said they‚Äôd have the contractor send temporary units but when I spoke to the contractor, they said the work order from Tricon said nothing about that. It‚Äôs been absolutely ridiculous how they‚Äôve handled this.

-Upon moving in, we found the house dirty ‚Äî garage filthy with dirt, cobwebs, leftover construction debris, etc.; downstairs with muddy footprints throughout; upstairs master bathroom and been used and not cleaned (disgusting); front porch covered in dirt; etc. Even after receiving the move in email that the house had been painted cleaned, etc. before our move, it most certainly was not cleaned and some areas not painted. These are summaries of our issues. I emailed the Tricon executive email to address the issues. Of course they never responded, even after a follow up email about the a/c. Can‚Äôt wait to get away from this home and away from Tricon. Take my advice and DO NOT rent with them.< /review>

< text>
Tricon bought out SilverBay and actually purchased the home I was leasing. I found them to do a pretty good job reacting to my maintenance requests and they always promptly returned my emails when I had questions. I found it easy to manage my account and make my payments through their portal. I purchased a home and had to terminate my lease early which did present a problem when I went to make my last rent payment. The Early Termination fee was included in that charge which made it impossible for me to pay in all in one lump sum. After receiving an eviction notice for non-payment I was able to talk to them and send them a check just for the Rent and Pet rent. That gave me time to complete the cleanup of the property. I did get my deposit applied to my early termination fee and did notice Tricon doing a lot of work on the home after the lease terminated. They seem to care about their properties and their tenants. My experience was good and I would recommend them.<//text>

I rented 311 May Oak Rd.Columbia SC. This company is a bad joke. They are so helpful when you 1st apply but once you sign those papers it all goes down hill from there. Our issues started day 1, The signing agent was late letting us in the home. The neighbors ran into my truck and left the scene of the accident. When we finally got in the home, the basement was exposed and leaking water.  It took 6 months for them to send a repair guy who couldn't fix the issue and another 3 months for the repair which to this day is still not fixed. There is an awful smell coming from the basement which made it embarrassing for me to have visitors over. There was a roach infestation that my fiance and I had to remedy at our own expense. Because of the basement issues lizards and birds would enter the home and the electric bill is grossly expensive because the home is not conserving energy property. I eventually was evicted because I couldn't afford light bills as high as the rent and if I paid 1 the other would have to be late. Oh and keep in mind if you are 10 days late the Sheriff will be knocking at you door to evict you. I would recommend trying to exhaust every other option before signing with this company. It's unfortunate that they are buying up all the properties in the city because they are slum lords posing as a reputable company.< /review>

We have had nothing but great service from Tricon!  The house is beautiful and in a great neighborhood.  It was updated before we moved in. <user_id>103985875394175514839</user_id><name>Foma Okosi<//name><date>1565955787249</date><Rating>1< /Rating>< text>
My experience with Tricon American Homes ended terribly. My family and I rented multiple homes with them for 4 years before we finalized on our home purchase in March 2019. We only stayed with them for convenience because they were a big company with lots of properties throughout GA to choose from and we decided to try different areas initially each year in order to conclude on where we want to purchase our home. The last home we rented from them, we ended up staying for 2 years. The company was just okay when it came to customer and providing maintenance support, until our last year, when we experienced how terrible they actual were. There was a leak in the home that lead to harmful and very active mildew and mold growth in our kitchen. It took them months before they finally resolved the leak, then even longer before they even attempted to take of the mold. Ultimately they never resolved the mold completely, the vendor they hired Trison Management was useless. We called, complained, submitted photos and literally got no where. It was absolutely astonishing.  We couldnt wait to close on our home and move out, because of the unsafe mold environment for ourselves and children. They did not care, the several people I spoke to were rude, and impersonal. They left us with no kitchen for almost 2 months in a failed attempt to remove the mold. The rude Tricon rep we spoke to, I think her name was Dawn, only offered a $60 credit towards our rent for the inconvenience. It would take me pages to breakdown the whole story. Finally when we were getting ready to move out the rude and impersonal Shanae Wiggins saw the pictures of the terrible mold and water damage throughout the kitchen and confirmed that we would not be liable at move out, that it was expected wear and tear. She didn't even care that we had to stay in such conditions. When we moved out they ended up still trying to keep our desposit and charge us for more money relating to the mold and water damage, that they NEVER RESOLVED. Eventually a reasonable person Anthony helped us in that area and got us back only part of our deposit. From everyone we corresponded on issues with, Anthony was the only one who showed patience and customer service.  Unless you want to deal with people that see you as just another tenant, only care about profits and lacks customer service, then I absolutely do not recommend this company.< /text>

We paid for the 8 days and are waiting on our deposit to be returned. I checked our account and they have added a charge for another day even though they said they wouldn't because it was their fault! Of course no one bothered to tell us there was an extra charge and now we have to go through the whole communication fiasco once more to get this straightened out.

If you are considering Tricon, believe the negative reviews and go elsewhere!<//review>

< Text>
I would give this company 1 star if it wasn't for Alainna going to bat for us. We applied for a home and a week goes by. The only contact we received was an email stating our application has been received and being review, someone should get back to us soon. We called Tricon and was told that no one picked up our application but looked at it now. We were approved, but the home we applied for was already taken. I asked if we could move our application to another house and I was told the $250  holding fee would be forfeit if we did that. I objected but proceeded with the application move anyway.

Two days go by, no contact. I called the office and was told by a very nice lady whose name escapes me that we were approved for the new home and they would not only refund the $250, but also the $90 in application fees. She asked me when we would like to move it and I told her Friday, July 12th, 2018.

I asked how to pay the rent and was advised to go to their Rent Cafe Portal, create the account and sign in. When I did, it showed an old address that I rented 2 years ago. I called Alainna and she advised me to send a money order to the office and where to send the proof of payment to while the money order is in transit. She stated not to pay on the portal since it shows the wrong address that way another company does not receive my payment. I didn't want to do it this way, but fair enough.

We then receive another call from Alainna the next day stating that everything is set and we can obtain the keys on Friday and someone would be in contact with us.

Friday comes, no call, no email, nothing. I called Tricon on my lunch and was told that he sees the request and a local rep would reach out to us. Again, no call. Here it is now 5 PM on Friday and we have no keys. I call Alainna who gets in touch with the property manager Fred, and he states our move in is scheduled for Monday, July 15th, not Friday.

However, we have emails and documents stating, "Move in date: Friday, July 12th, 2019." He stated he would get back with us. Approximately 2 hours go by, nothing. My wife calls him back and again says, "I was told your move in date was Monday, not Friday!" I then took over the phone call and advised Fred that we have movers coming tomorrow morning at 8 AM. I also stated I'm looking at an email stating "Move in date: FRIDAY, July 12th, 2019." I forwarded him the email and he apologized for the "lack of communication" and provided us the code to the box to get into the house.

We move in Saturday, life is great... or so we thought.

I then receive a call from Rachel (who goes by "Sofia") stating that they have not received payment from us and asked when they are going to receive it. I told her what Alainna advised us and she very rudely told me, "that's not the correct way, you needed to pay through the portal. You can't move in until we receive payment." I told her that I sent payment via certified mail, why I didn't pay on the portal and told her we already have the keys and moved in per Fred.

I logged into the portal to check how much is owed on Thursday, July 25th and it still showed the incorrect address. I did not have a chance to log in Friday to check. I log into the portal again on Sunday, July 28th and it showed the correct address and the incorrect amount. It stated we owed WAY more than we should.

I then checked the tracking on certified mail, still in transit. Tricon was supposed to receive the payment on July 15th. Sofia stated on the phone to me on July 15th, "as long as we receive payment today you're good." Okay, then why wasn't I contacted when payment wasn't received? Where was the communication with the tenant? Why did it take so long for my address to be corrected? If Sofia was so concerned about their payment, why wasn't I notified by her that payment was not received?

In short, Tricon has a complete LACK of internal communication. Alainna did everything in her power to keep us in our home. And with her professional assistance, we are staying!

There's more to this story but Google limits characters.</Text>

I had to push the issue, and kept stating over multiple phone calls the bees were INSIDE the wall. <Text>I have been given the run - around all week with the maintenance department. FOR WHAT!!!  THE FIRST PERSON WASN'T DISPATCHED RIGHT, SO HOW DO I KNOW THE NEXT APPOINTMENT WILL BE HONORED?!?!

I placed an online maintenance request on Saturday, July 15, 2017 requesting an appointment for Monday, July 17, 2017.  Supposedly, my request was never received, so I had to complete the request by phone.  I was promised that someone would call me with the appointment date and time, but I never heard from anyone.  I called again on Tuesday and was told the same thing.  I made another online request on Wednesday, July 19, 2017 and followed up with another phone call on Thursday, July 20, 2017.  I was told that a technician will be here today, July 21, 2017 between 8 and 11 AM.  By 11 AM, I had not heard from anyone, so I called the office...YET AGAIN...I was then told that the technician was not dispatched and that their earlier appointment would be....(I did not even listed to the available appointment because at this point, I am livid).

As I sat here to type this review, I hear a knock on the door.  Whose outside my door at 11:30 AM?  TRICON!!!  The technician said he was dispatched at 11 AM, which was about the time I was making the call to the company to determine when someone was coming, only to be LIED TO that the technician had not been dispatched.  I have never, in the three years of living in my home, had problems with the property management, maintenance, etc. until Tricon purchased my home.  I am so upset right now that I have tears in my eyes.  The maintenance department do not value people time or need.  I am a VERY unhappy tenant right now.

I pay my rent on time (before the due date) each month, and all I want is to make sure I get the service I deserve and need, the same service Tricon expect and deserve.  At the end of my lease, or whenever i decide that I am going to vacate the premises, I DO NOT WANT or NEED any discrepancies in the move - out inspection.  The manner in which I received the home is the manner in which I expect to return the home to the owner or property manager.  I don't know how anyone can bounce back from such poor customer service.

Amber, the maintenance coordinator, returned my call to offer another appointment, and I appreciate that, but the damage has been done.  I pray that I do not need any further maintenance needs before my lease ends because I feel like I will receive the same type of service as I have received this week, and this is absolutely unacceptable.< /Text>< rating>

I have only recently moved into a property managed by Tricon American Homes and the entire process has been a wonderful, seamless experience. The staff has been very responsive and professional; and were attentive to my requests to help ease my transition from TN to TX. Two members of the team, Alan Todd and Alainna Oka, were especially helpful with my move-in and made sure I moved in successfully and understood the ins and outs of the property. Mr. Todd has also checked in to make sure everything was going well and reiterated contact information for persons to assist in resolving any issue should they arise.

I can't say enough about the team I have worked with (from application to move-in) and would like to thank each of them for making this move for my family one less stressful component of our move.

Update: Almost one year later and time to renew our lease. I really hope we don't regret it though. I'm only going to go down one star because we have enjoyed our experience here and past maintenance requests have previously been attended to fairly quick. Now we have a request for AC issues and in this heat it can get up between 85-90¬∞ inside the home. We are going on 2 weeks now and still nothing and this is the second time within 3 months of having the same issue. But overall, there are no other complaints.< /review>

<review>UPDATE TO MY REVIEW

My initial problem was that even though I had sent my security deposit to Tricon about 6 weeks before my move-in date, I didn't receive my lease agreement until about 5 days before moving in. This was because there was a bit of work being done on the house and they couldn't send the lease agreement until the work was done. I got a call from the regional director not long afterwards and everything was made right. The move-in appointment went very smoothly and we love the new place and are very happy with it.

******************************************

ORIGINAL POST

I'm jealous of all of these 5-star reviews and stories of really responsive representatives. We're trying to move in to one of Tricon's homes. I sent my security deposit in over a month ago (which they demanded 48 hours after my application was accepted. I obliged and sent it FedEx and got it to them the next day). I am now a week away from moving in and I still don't have a lease agreement. Every time I try to get a hold of the lease agent, I need to call multiple times and send an e-mail. She can't give me a straight answer on when I'll have the lease agreement. It's unclear what's holding the process up. It seems like the place will be great, but I've never had this much trouble getting a lease agreement.</review></record>

At Tricon American Homes, in order to treat everyone equitably and stay in compliance with Fair Housing and Equal Opportunity laws, we utilize a third-party credit rating agency. This makes me very unsure about the professionalism of the company. I never had any problems with rent and I was easily approved for the transfer. It's upsetting to get your hopes up about a property, and have all your things in boxes ready to move just to be told "I'm sorry". I found another property that was 100 above my price range online in the area where my new job is located  and asked if she would be able to lower the price on that one since there were no longer any places available in my price range in that area. I was told no because they would just find someone who could afford that place, but the point was I was suppose to be able to move in to a place in my price range that I actually wanted but you're company made a mistake and you can't offer me any type of discount?? I received a call from a senior manager that explained to me that they are sorry that I was in a home that had several issues. They are refunding me my security deposit with is awesome as  I have purchased a home and will use my deposit towards my new home.

I would stay far away from renting properties from Tricon American Homes. They have too many properties to deal with and will not make your issues seem like they are important, ever.

I first moved into a property in the Houston area and when I moved into the place it was barely cleaned but I had to take the keys as I was coming in from out of town and wasn‚Äôt going to spend more money on a hotel. It was obvious that Tricon didn‚Äôt do an actual pre-inspection of this property. I discovered broken cabinet drawer in kitchen, chewed up blinds, overgrown bushes that should have been removed (blocking view of driveway), the steel rod at end of the driveway curb was completely exposed,  and all three of the sinks had caved in cabinets under them. The stove was hard wired into the wall so the clock worked but the stove did not. It took them 8 days to get it fixed after I discovered it the day after I got my keys. The day after I got my keys, I also realized I had no hot water and that required major repairs to the hot water tank that took 5 days for them to get to. Two weeks after moving in I came home to water coming thru the ceiling in my kitchen. Took them 4 days to get someone out with the diagnosis being the new AC was installed without a drip pan to drain. That took 8 total days to get fixed. Fast forward a few months later and I go out of state to get married and move my new bride to Texas into the rental property. We walk into the house after me being gone for 5 days and I have major water leaking thru the celling in the dinning room. While I was gone the pipes in the bathroom broke. It took them 3 days to get someone out to look at it and a total of 9 days till the celling and toilets were fixed. The water leaking ruined about $600 worth of kitchen appliances that were sitting on a metal shelving. The leak also cost me another $300 in that months water bill.

With all of this my new bride and I decided to break our lease and look into buying a home before we had any other issues. Tricon did not give me any leeway with the two month lease breaking penalty indicating the issues I had in the rental home were mostly things that come up with normal rental homes. To accomplish this, we are dedicated to returning every home to it‚Äôs original condition before a new resident moves in. A portion of your security deposit was returned after damages were accessed as excessive and beyond normal wear and tear. Maintenance Tech Hurther Baker, from the Charlotte area office - possibly THE best tech we've ever had in our home??  Friendly, nice, easy to have a conversation with, all while being exceptionally professional and knowledgeable.  Wow.  I'm probably a bit more critical than most people when it comes to service and I don't easily write 5-star reviews, but there is nothing more I could possibly hope for in a home tech than the service Mr. Baker provided.  He knocked out 4 'minor' maintenance issues within 1-hr, and from my observation and knowledge of the issues, he fixed them all the RIGHT way - not the quick-let-me-outta-here way.  I don't believe we'll have these same issues bother us for as long as we stay in this house.

In general, we've found Tricon to be very responsive to maintenance issues (although I'm happy to report that we've rarely ever encountered maintenance issues).  However, it's great to know that even in the rare event that we do have an actual maintenance issue (even 'minor', non-emergency ones), Tricon has people like Mr. Baker on staff who knows how to fix things and is the absolute nicest, most professional person you'll have the fortune of having in your home.  Thank you Mr. Baker.< /text>

< review>
I found a property in Georgia & it is beautiful & I have no complaints about it.  But I do have a complaint about the people handling maintenance issues. I moved into the property at the end of June & the first week in, I noticed that one of the toilets constantly ran after is was flushed...the same issue I brought up to the agent as he as showing me the property.  They got someone out to fix it in a timely manner, but the problem came trying to get reimbursed for an extremely high water bill.  I got the run around for so long about that, that I had to go thru someone else, other the property maintenance supervisor, to take care of my credit, which didn't happen until the following months bill generated.  By then, late charges have accrued, but I am having a hard time trying to get Tricon to take care of these fees as well. I call & leave message & send emails, but I never get any response..HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!<//review>

<review>I'm 6 months in to my first lease with Tricon.  Shortly after I moved in I identified a drain leak and drain fly infestation, the plumber Tricon sent out recommended moisture remediation and a lime treatment for the crawl space that still has not been completed.  A month or two later my HVAC system shut down due to a carbon monoxide safety feature, the contractor reported a rusted heat exchanger that required replacing the entire unit.  Noted an odor in the attic and reported it, contractors in hazmat suits went in and ventilated the attic over a weekend while I was in the house.  They indicated that repairs were needed to prevent recurrence, those have not been acted on.  Tricon doesn't answer phone calls or respond to voice mail.  Contractors have hauled two trailer loads of debris from the yard since I moved in, the photos show the debris piles that remain and the areas of the yard that have not been touched.  I don't know if this is a typical Tricon experience or if the property I am renting has slipped between the cracks.  So far I have been exposed to carbon monoxide and mold particles and can't get Tricon to detail my exposure for risk assessment.  If you are considering renting a home from Tricon please take my experience into account.  Good luck!

Update.  Tricon has been responsive since this post, an additional 8 trailer loads of debris have been removed from my backyard, I would estimate that we are about 80% of the way to acceptable.  The HVAC system has been replaced and they installed a carbon monoxide detector.  I am being called weekly to report status and appreciate the effort to make this right.  The folks I have dealt with seem to be genuinely interested in fixing this, I think they have added so many homes at such a rapid pace that staff is overwhelmed.<//review>< pictures>

I moved into my rental property in Phoenix, Az May 2015 with Silverbay Management as my leasing company. I had no problems with Silverbay. Our fenice which was not properly installed had deteriorated over the years. We had tried to advise them on several occasions what needed to be done. They however have chosen to patch work the job to the tune of probably close to a dozen visits by 4 different companies. Now last year when the option to renew our lease came about that along with our change in financial situation became a huge concern. We had been consistently late and getting hit with 5 day notices to pay or quit by the 6th of each month. In all my years of collection experience and Property Management I have never heard of a company not accepting a payment arrangement. I thought that's why they had late fees? We have not been perfect renters but we have tried. We have never broken a promise to them or not taken care of our home. < Text>
I rented a property from Tricon American Homes in Riverside County, CA. I never had issues when it came to repairs. HOWEVER, anytime I had to deal with Retention Specialists (Marlena Buksh, Marlena Sanchez), Portfolio Manager (Claudia Moya), and Assistant Portfolio Manager (Marisa Markham) I had problems. Mainly it was communication problems. Ms. Sanchez and Buksh responded weeks, if not a month after I called and left messages and sent several emails. Ms. Markham I emailed on February 21st, 2017, and she has yet to contact me. My BIGGEST issue is that I moved out of my rental January 31st and have yet to receive my security deposit from Tricon. I made every payment on time and in full for 3 years and 7 months. I left the property cleaner than I received. As a matter of fact a new tenant application was accepted 3 days after I turned in keys because I left them a property that was move in ready. I have left messages and sent emails to get my security deposit back, but am getting nowhere with Tricon. Ms. Moya, who writes these checks is unreachable. Ms. Moya is now 4 weeks late in giving me my security deposit or any accounting for that money. I contacted Tricon to get a mailing address for Ms. Moya and got the address 1508 Brookhollow Drive, Santa Ana, CA 92705. I went to the post office and was told I need a suite number. Please make sure to ask for it if you need it, since Jennifer, from Tricon American Homes customer service neglected to provide me with that information. I have mailed Ms. Moya a letter demanding my security deposit. In all honesty I would avoid any property managed by Tricon American Homes for their lack of communication and integrity.</Text>

<review>The maintenence side of Tricon is terrible, at least for my property. It took them 6 months of me calling to have them install rain gutters, which they agreed should have already been on.

I requested someone look at the house to see my concerns I've been noticing. They sent a contractor out who wrote it all down and took pictures, saying he will take care of everything. After 2 weeks with no contact from anyone, I had to call Tricon. They didn't know if the order was assigned to anyone, or if anyone had even come out to the house yet. The next day I was called by a new contractor who repeated the same process with no contact after 2 weeks. The 3rd time, they sent the Tricon superintendent. He said the moisture could be from the AC pick up vent being dirty, and that we should change the filter out each month. Then he said they actually recommend using the cheaper air filters, and not to buy the better ones because the cheaper ones allow more airflow, which in turn would actually help cool the house faster. The inside of every vent in the house had large amounts of green and white mold growing. It's been 11 days since I received the response about the mold, and I still haven't heard anything from anyone. < review>
It has been an ABSOLUTE NIGHTMARE since Tricon took over Silverbay. The maintenance response has been UTTERLY EMBARRASSING. In June, our A/C went out in the middle of the day on a Saturday. I immediately called and made a maintenance request. I was told they would contact a vendor and someone would be out as soon as possible. Several hours later, Tricon called back and said they couldn't find someone to come out because they couldn't find a vendor that services my area, but someone would definitely be to the house on Sunday. I ended up having to put my large family in a hotel room for the night. Sunday came and went. I talked to Tricon multiple times and all they ever said was that they could not find a vendor that services my area. My family again had to stay in a hotel room. Tricon said someone would definitely be out to the house on Monday. Monday afternoon came and Tricon still had not found a vendor. After multiple phone calls and raising enough fuss, I finally got to speak to someone in my "local" Tricon office. Tracy Downing (portfolio manager) assured me that someone would be out. I finally got tired of waiting and my family needed to be able to go back home. So I called my own repair guy. He was there within 2 hours. And he had the problem fixed in under an hour.
I called Tricon and explained that it cost a lot of money to put my family in a hotel room and I had to pay out of pocket for the A/C repair. Tracy Downing emailed me and me to send her my hotel bill and repair bill and she would submit it for approval for reimbursement. After another week of calling and emailing with no response, she finally responded that Tricon would reimburse me for the repair, but only $90 a day for the hotel! Tricon expects a large family to be able to stay in a hotel for only $90 a day?! I explained to her that she never mentioned a limit for reimbursement and that this was unacceptable. She told me she would get in touch with her boss. It's been several days since I've heard from her now. Its ridiculous that this company expects a family to pay out of pocket to stay at a hotel for more than $90 a day.
Last week, we went through the same type of issue with a busted water pipe in the front yard. It burst in the middle of the day on a week day. We immediately reported it, but Tricon claimed they couldn't find a vendor that services my area. It took them a day and a half to get someone to come repair it.
How are you a national rental company, but you can't find vendors that service areas where you own property?
Lately, I have tried to call two different people in my local Tricon office: Tracy Downing and Abby Boorstin. Neither one of them ever answer their phone or return phone calls. This is pathetic customer service. I will not be renewing my lease at the end of this term and if I could find a way to get out of the lease I have now without paying an absurdly high penalty, I would.<//review>
